entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 1:40PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Colville River This Week... Runoff from heavy rainfall over the upper Colville River Basin is moving downriver this week. Between 1.00 to 1.75 inches of rain fell between Sunday morning to Monday morning in the foothills of the Brooks Range. Water levels will rise significantly and may approach bankfull in some low lying areas. The crest of water is
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 8:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RELEASE OF GLACIER DAMMED LAKE ON THE SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER... WATER LEVELS ON THE SALMON RIVER NEAR HYDER, ALASKA BEGAN RISING BEYOND THE NORMAL DAILY RISE ON SUNDAY NIGHT. THE RIVER HAS BEEN RISING AT APPROXIMATELY 1 FOOT IN 18 HOURS. IN THE PAST THIS EVENT IS ABOUT 4 DAYS LONG FROM START TO FINISH, WHICH WOULD PUT THE CREST ON THURSDAY THE 29TH. HOWEVER, THIS IS AN EARLIER THAN NORMAL

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...The Taku River and areas along the Taku Inlet. * WHEN...Until 800 AM AKDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Washington County through 715 PM CDT... At 630 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northeast of Fruitdale, or 6 miles southwest of Chatom, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 6:18PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Baldwin and west central Escambia Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 618 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Loxley, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

At 414 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ski Bluewood, or 23 miles southeast of Dayton, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.
